commit_list.message:
Removed isVulnerable check so vulnerabilities are written to log.

Vulnerabilities are now written to log with WARN level if verbose flag is true. Vulnerabilities were never written to log regardless of verbose flag, only files not containing vulnerabilities were written to log. This should now be fixed.

commit_list.message:
Change exec name to include target

When downloading the same file to two different folders, Puppet will detect duplication and abort. To avoid this we include the destination directory in the name.
commit_list.repo_description: pget - Module for downloading files onto a Windows system

commit_list.message:
Support for overriding destination filename

Adds support to specify the filename of the downloaded file.

Useful when downloading from servers that does redirect.

Example: `http://mvn/nexus/service/local/artifact/maven/redirect?r=snapshots&g=org.apache&a=stringutils&v=1.20&e=jar` will result in the desintation file being `redirect`.

Now you can specify `targetfilename` as `stringutils.jar`.

Example usage:

```
 pget{'Download puppet':
   source  => "http://downloads.puppetlabs.com/windows/puppet-3.4.1.msi",
   target  => "C:/software",
   targetfilename => "my-puppet-install.msi",
   username=> "myuser",
   password=> "password1'
 }
```
commit_list.repo_description: pget - Module for downloading files onto a Windows system
